## icons package

## Functions

<table><thead><tr><th>

Function


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

[getIcon(name, ext, indicator)](./icons.geticon.md)


</td><td>

Returns the icon glyph and color based on filename, extension, and indicator.

The lookup order is: 1. For directories: check IconDir, then default to hiddendir or dir 2. For files: - Check IconFileName for exact filename matches - Check for special cases (e.g., Go test files) - Check IconSubExt for compound extensions (e.g., .test.ts) - Check IconExt for file extensions - Default to hiddenfile or file based on hidden status 3. For executables: apply green color


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[getIndicator(mode)](./icons.getindicator.md)


</td><td>

Returns the indicator for the given file mode.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

Interface


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

[IconInfo](./icons.iconinfo.md)


</td><td>

IconInfo represents information about an icon including its glyph and color.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[IconResult](./icons.iconresult.md)


</td><td>

Result of getIcon function containing the glyph and ANSI color code.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

</td><td>

Icon mappings for specific filenames.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[IconSet](./icons.iconset.md)


</td><td>

Icon set containing all available icons organized by type.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[IconSubExt](./icons.iconsubext.md)


</td><td>

</td></tr>
